verb.description: Compensate for the faults or bad aspects of (something)
examples: a disappointing debate redeemed only by an outstanding speech
the splendid views are the one redeeming feature of the center

verb.description: Gain or regain possession of (something) in exchange for payment.
examples: his best suit had been redeemed from the pawnbrokers

verb.description: Fulfill or carry out (a pledge or promise)
examples: the party prepared to redeem the pledges of the past three years

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense buy back): from Old French redimer or Latin redimere, from re- back + emere buy.
